description:
'''The Dandy Warhols''' are an American [[psychedelic rock|psychedelic]]/{{nowrap|[[alternative rock]]}} band, formed in [[Portland, Oregon|Portland]], [[Oregon]], in 1994 by singer-guitarist [[Courtney Taylor-Taylor]] and guitarist [[Peter Holmstr√∂m]]. They were later joined by keyboardist [[Zia McCabe]] and drummer Eric Hedford. Hedford left in 1998 and was replaced by Taylor-Taylor's cousin [[Brent DeBoer]]. The band's name is a play on the name of American [[pop art]]ist [[Andy Warhol]].

The band gained recognition after they were signed to [[Capitol Records]] and released their [[Record label|major label]] album debut, ''[[...The Dandy Warhols Come Down]]'', in 1997. In 2001, the band rose to new levels of fame after their song "[[Bohemian Like You]]" enjoyed extensive exposure due to being featured in a [[Vodafone]] advertisement. The Dandy Warhols were the subject of the 2004 documentary film ''[[Dig!]]'', along with [[San Francisco]] [[Psychedelia|psychedelic]] outfit [[The Brian Jonestown Massacre]]. They have released 12 [[studio album]]s, two [[compilation album]]s, six [[Extended play|EP]]s, and 27 [[Single (music)|singles]] to date.
